sen.j: （六男とも）森冠者、陸奥冠者、陸奥六郎または陸奥七郎などと号したという（七男であるが、四兄が家人の高階氏に養子入りした関係で六郎ともいう）。
sen.e: Together with the sixth son, his cohort included the youthful Mori and youthful Mutsu as they were known: Rokuro MUTSU and also Shichiro MUTSU (there were seven sons but the fourth eldest son in the family of the Takashina clan was adopted into the family and is also said to have been Rokuro).

Together with the sixth son in his family, his cohort included the youthful Mori and youthful Mutsu as they were known: Rokuro MUTSU and Shichiro MUTSU (there were seven sons, but the fourth eldest son in the family of the Takashina clan was adopted into the family and is also said to have been Rokuro).

Together with the sixth son in his family, his cohort included Mori kanja and Mutsu kanja as they were known: Rokuro MUTSU and Shichiro MUTSU (there were seven sons, but the fourth eldest son in the family of the Takashina clan was adopted into the family and is also said to have been Rokuro).

sen.j: この巻では藤原信頼と源義朝が挙兵し、天皇及び後白河天皇を幽閉し、自らを官軍として政敵藤原信西・平清盛の打倒を目論んだが、熊野詣をしていた清盛が密かに帝と院を救出。
sen.e: In this tome the FUJIWARA Nobuyori and Minamoto no Yoshitomo raise armies, confine the emperor, Emperor Goshirakawa, personally use the imperial forces intending to overthrow their political foes FUJIWARA no Shinzei and TAIRA no Kiyomori but, Kiyomori who is on a trip to Kumano secretly rescues the emperor and empress.

sen.j: 大将に悪右衛門督信頼、その子 新侍従藤原信親、信頼の実兄にあたる兵部権大輔藤原家頼、民部権少輔藤原基成、弟の尾張少将藤原信説、そのほかに伏見源中納言源師仲、越後中将藤原成親、治部卿兼通、伊予前司信員、壱岐守貞知、但馬守有房、兵庫頭源頼政、出雲前司源光保（光保）、伊賀守光基、河内守源季実、その子息左衛門尉季盛、義朝はじめ源氏一門ではまず左馬頭義朝を筆頭に、長子鎌倉悪源太源義平、次男中宮大夫進源朝長、三男兵衛佐源頼朝、義朝の叔父陸奥六郎義隆、義朝の弟新宮十郎源行家、従兄弟の佐渡式部大輔（大夫）源重成、平賀四郎平賀義宣とある。
sen.e: Generals were: the Evil Uemon-no-kami (Captain of the Right Division of the Headquarters of the Outer Palace) Nobuyori, his child the new Chamberlain FUJIWARA no Nobuchika, Nobuyori's own elder brother FUJIWARA no Ieyori the Hyobugontaiyu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Military), Minbugonshofu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Popular Affairs) FUJIWARA no Motonari, younger brother FUJIWARA no Motonari the Owari Shosho (Minor captain of Owari Province), besides them Middle counselor of Fushimi-Genji (Minamoto clan) MINAMOTO no Moronaka, Middle captain of Echigo FUJIWARA no Narichika, jibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration) Kanemichi, the former official of Iyo Province Nobutaka, Sadatomo the Governor of Iki Province, Arifusa the Governor of Tanba Province, MINAMOTO no Yorimasa the Head of Hyogo, MINAMOTO no Mitsuyasu the former official of Izuo Province (Mitsuyasu), Mitsumoto the Governor of Iga Province, MINAMOTO no Suezane the Governor of Kawachi, their children Suemori the saemon-no-jo (Secretary of the Left Division of the Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guard) for the first time in the Minamoto clan Yoshitomo was first on the list for Sama-no-kami (Chief of the Bureau of Horses), his eldest son Kamakura aku (evil) Genta MINAMOTO no Yoshihira, his second son MINAMOTO no Asanaga was chugudaifu (Master of the Empress' Palace), third son MINAMOTO no Yoritomo was Hyoe-no-suke (Assistant at Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guard), Yoshitomo`s uncle Rokuro MUTSU Yoshitaka, Yoshitomo's younger brothers Juro SHINGU and MINAMOTO no Yukiie, cousin MINAMOTO no Shigenari who was Sado shikibu-taiyu (the assistant minister of the Ceremonial Ministry, and also in charge of Sado Province)(Grand Master) and also Shirohei Hiraga and Yoshinori Hiraga,

sen.j: 一度は長井別当実盛が僧兵を説き伏せ、窮地を脱したものの、今度は横川（よがわ）の法師達が龍華越のあたりで待ち構えており、僧兵が弓矢を射掛けててきた。
sen.e: On one occasion Nagai's steward Sanemori prevailed upon the warrior priests, explaining his predicament: after this the Yogawa priests lay in wait in the vicinity of Ryugegoe whereupon the warrior priests fired a barrage of arrows at them.

sen.j: 義隆は馬が疲れて少しの間、戦線から下がっていたが、複数の法師が義隆を取り囲んで無数の矢を射掛けてきたので、義隆は太刀をふるって追っ払ってはみたものの、龍華越は山蔭の道は難所である故、馬を駆けさせるところもなかった。
sen.e: Yoshitaka's horse was weary and for a short while removed himself from the front but, a number of the priests surrounded Yoshitaka and because they fired countless arrows, Yoshitaka tried to pursue them flailing his long sword but by reason that the Ryugegoe has rough mountain roads, there was no where for horse to advance to.

sen.e: During the Chinese Northern & Southern Dynasty period, the Ashikaga clan was prominent within the Minamoto clan so when the Ashikaga clan leader ASHIKAGA Takauji Kuge revolted against the Kenmu administration, because the Kuge clan hastened to the Ashikaga camp at the front, they obtained substantial amounts of territory within Tanba Province and amassed the most power and influence within Tanba Province.

sen.j: 森頼定の次男、森定氏の子孫は美濃森家として戦国武将、近世大名としての成長を遂げる。
sen.e: Second son Yorisada MORI as a descendent of the Mori Sada Clan was a Sengoku (Warring States) warrior being from the Mino-Mori family. He grew in stature as a Daimyo of those times but, in the process he became kin of the Seki clan of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), ultimately was included in the ranks of vassals and during the Edo period when the Seki clan became a branch family was given a portion of the estate took an adopted son and became an ordinary family in the Mori family.

Second son Yorisada MORI, as a descendent of the Mori Sada Clan, was a Sengoku (Warring States) warrior being from the Mino-Mori family. He grew in stature as a Daimyo of those times, but in the process he became kin of the Seki clan of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) and was ultimately included in the ranks of vassals, and during the Edo period when the Seki clan became a branch family was given a portion of the estate, took an adopted son, and they became an ordinary family in the Mori family.
The second son of Yorisada MORI, Sadauji MORI's descendent from the Mino-Mori family grew in stature as a busho (Japanese military commander) and a daimyo in the Sengoku period.

sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処Theを補足しました。

sen.j: 七男・森義通の嫡男は笠合義宗を名乗り笠合氏となる。
sen.e: The seventh son Yoshimichi MORI's eldest son went by the name Yoshimune KASAAI (笠合) which lead to the Kasaai (笠合) clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処Theを補足しました。(笠合)[読み不明]

sen.j: 頼定九男 伊豆守戸田信義にはじまる戸田氏は当初、尾張国に拠点を置いていたが、次第に三河国に勢力を拡大した。
sen.e: Yorisada's 9th son Nobuyoshi TODA was Governor of Izu Province a first for the Toda clan. He established strongholds in Owari Province but, gradually extended his influence to Mikawa Province. Establishing the Atsumi Peninsula as a stronghold he shaped his power into 3 parts: the Matsudaira clan, the Makino clan and Mikawa.

Yorisada's 9th son Nobuyoshi TODA was Governor of Izu Province, a first for the Toda clan. He established strongholds in Owari Province and gradually extended his influence to Mikawa Province. Establishing the Atsumi Peninsula as a stronghold, he shaped his power into 3 parts: the Matsudaira clan, the Makino clan, and Mikawa.

Yorisada's 9th son Nobuyoshi TODA, was Izu no kami (Governor of Izu Province) and a first for the Toda clan, established strongholds in Owari Province and gradually extended his influence to Mikawa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処全角の’を半角にしました。コンマ補足、Izu no kami補足、説明を括弧に入れました。And補足し、一文にしました。

sen.j: 渥美半島を拠点として松平氏・牧野氏と三河を三分する勢力を形成する。
sen.e: The Tida clan established the Atsumi Peninsula as a stronghold and shaped the power into 3 parts in Mikawa with the Matsudaira clan, the Makino clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処ここの主語は「戸田氏」と読みましたので、The Tida clan established とし、以下訂正しました。

sen.j: しかし、今川氏・織田氏・松平氏という大勢力に囲まれてそれらの配下として主家を転々とし、
sen.e: However, the Imagawa clan, Oda clan and Matsudaira clan who controlled a large portion of the powerbase were subordinates and often shuffled by the main family. On the Imagawa side at one stage they were moved by the Oda family and once ruined but, once the descendants became followers of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA through deeds of valor they initially became hereditary lords who produced numerous vassals and retainer warriors and, started fiefdoms.

However, the Imagawa clan, Oda clan, and Matsudaira clan, who controlled a large portion of the powerbase, were subordinate to and often shuffled by the main family. On the Imagawa side at one stage they were moved by the Oda family and once ruined, but once the descendants became followers of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA through deeds of valor they initially became hereditary lords who produced numerous vassals and retainer warriors and started fiefdoms.
However, the Toda clan, sorounded by the Imagawa clan, Oda clan and Matsudaira clan who controlled a large portion of the powerbase, were subordinate to and often shuffled by the master family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処ここの主語は「戸田氏」と読みましたので、The Toda clan established とし、以下訂正しました→the Toda clan, sorounded by～コンマ削除しました。the master family

sen.j: 今川方にある時に織田氏に転じて一度は滅ぼされるが、子孫が徳川家康の配下となり武勲を挙げて譜代大名をはじめ旗本、親藩の藩士などを輩出する。
sen.e: Once the Toda clan was on the Imagawa side, they were moved to the Oda family and ruined, but after that the descendants became followers of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA through deeds of valor they became fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and feudal retainer of shinpan (relatives of the Tokugawa family).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処ここの主語は「戸田氏」と読みましたので、以下訂正しました→Once the Toda clan was on the Imagawa side,～and ruined, but after that～initially削除譜代大名→fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family)旗本→hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)親藩の藩士→feudal retainer of shinpan (relatives of the Tokugawa family)

sen.j: 戸田氏の嫡流は康長は徳川家康の異母妹 松姫の婿となり松平康長となり代々、松平姓を継承する。
sen.e: Lineage of the Toda clan came from Yasunaga: who was Yasunaga MATSUDAIRA groom of Princess Matsu, the younger sister of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's step-mother who over a number of generations inherited the Matsudaira name.

Lineage of the Toda clan came from Yasunaga: who was Yasunaga MATSUDAIRA, groom of Princess Matsu, the younger sister of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's step-mother, who over a number of generations inherited the Matsudaira name.

Yasunaga, a direct descendant of the Toda clan, who married Princess Matsu, the stepsister of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA from different mothers, and being adopted by his wife's family he went by the name as Yasunaga MATSUDAIRA; from then, over a number of generations the name of Matsudaira clan had been inherited.
sen.cmt: 文の意味が不明になっているので訂正しました。

sen.j: なお、森頼定のいずれの子孫かさだかでないが、讃岐国の豪族に陸奥七郎義隆の子孫と伝わる森氏があった。
sen.e: Moreover, descendents of Yorisada MORI are either way not numerous but, there is a Mori clan mentioned amongst the descendents of the powerful Shichiro MUTSU Yoshitaka clan in Sanuki Province.
Moreover, descendents of Yorisada MORI are by no means numerous, but there is a Mori clan mentioned amongst the descendents of the powerful Shichiro MUTSU Yoshitaka clan in Sanuki Province.
Moreover, descendents of Yorisada MORI are by no means numerous, but there is a Mori clan mentioned of Shichiro Yoshitaka MUTSUI's descendents amongst the local ruling family in Sanuki Province.
sen.cmt: 文の意味が不明になっているので訂正しました。

sen.j: 四男・近江守高松定隆は長じた後、陸奥国白河市に所領を得る。
sen.e: After the fourth son, Sadataka TAKAMATSU who was Governor of Omi Province grew older, obtained some territory in Shirakawa City, Mutsu Province.
After the fourth son, Sadataka TAKAMATSU, who was Governor of Omi Province, grew older, he obtained some territory in Shirakawa City, Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 四代の子孫 高松定安は南北朝時代、南朝方に組して北畠顕家の幕下に入り、利根川において足利尊氏の大軍を打ち破るという。
sen.e: Fourth generation descendent Sadayasu TAKAMATSU the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties, cooperated with the Nancho (the Southern Dynasty) by joining Akiie KITABATAKE's circle and, is said to have crushed a general of Takauji ASHIKAGA at Tone-gawa River.

Fourth generation descendent Sadayasu TAKAMATSU: during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties, cooperated with the Nancho (the Southern Dynasty) by joining Akiie KITABATAKE's circle and is said to have crushed a general of Takauji ASHIKAGA at Tone-gawa River.

During the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, the fourth generation descendent Sadayasu TAKAMATSU cooperated with the Southern Court by joining Akiie KITABATAKE's circle and is said to have crushed a general of Takauji ASHIKAGA at Tone-gawa River.
sen.cmt: 文の意味が不明になっているので訂正しました。南北朝時代→the period of the Northern and Southern Courts訂正しました。南朝→the Southern Court訂正しました。

sen.j: 伊達氏の家臣である、懸田氏は高松氏の子孫を名乗るものの、その系図は高松氏を森頼定の後胤として記されており、真偽については歴史学的検証を待つところである。
sen.e: The Kakeda clan who were retainers of the Date clan claimed to be descendents of the Takamatsu clan, with this pedigree of the Takamatsu clan was recorded by Yorisada MORI and the veracity of this awaits to be examined by historians.

sen.e: Besides this, descendants of Yoshitaka are said to include the: Otaki clan, 2 Inamori clans (same sounding name written with different characters), Kurosawa clan and others but this matter and details are not entirely clear.
